frontmatter.title: Trip to Japan: Booking multiple connections tickets
frontmatter.description: As I was planning my trip, my top choice stood on affordable flights. As risky as it is sometimes, I want to share some disadvantages of cheap traveling through SEASIA by multiple connections flights

frontmatter.title: How I discovered, that remote work not only allows you to work from home
frontmatter.description: I worked remotely from another country to improve my mental and physical health. I want to share quick note how it worked out, and what my future steps might be

frontmatter.title: Automate Instagram feed with GramAddict
frontmatter.description: Sometimes I don't have time to browse Instagram, and as you know - spent time on your account will definitely help your SEO and getting your online activity noticed by others. For this I have now GramAddict

frontmatter.title: Joining #100DaysOfHomeLab Challenge
frontmatter.description: At the beginning of the month, following the words of my friend, I started looking into putting up a HomeLab server. After many instances during this short journey, I finally managed to make a server to put up my home services, which I needed for a long time

frontmatter.title: Building ad-block home server from the scratch. Again...
frontmatter.description: After the recent chaos I found on my Raspberry Pi server and its unstable performance I made a fresh attempt to build a simple ad filter in my home using rPi

frontmatter.title: Map all AWS resources and make a vulnerability report using cloudmapper
frontmatter.description: Last time I remembered about a tool that allows you to create a big map of current resources present in your AWS account, and based on it make a report of potential vulnerabilities, threats, unused resources and much more. I can thank a colleague at work for finding it - such explorers are a real treasure!

frontmatter.title: Secure files using git-crypt
frontmatter.description: With the use of git-crypt, we can secure sensitive data, keys or passwords without separating them outside the repository

frontmatter.title: Using Github 'actions'
frontmatter.description: When creating pipelines, we often use already-made code we've written ourselves in previous projects. Whether in GitHub Actions we can replace them with maintained actions!
